title: La Voix du Luxembourg
text:
La Voix du Luxembourg was a <a href="French%20language">French-language</a> <a href="newspaper">newspaper</a> published in <a href="Luxembourg">Luxembourg</a> between 2001 and 2011.
History and profile.
Published by <a href="Saint-Paul%20Luxembourg">Saint-Paul Luxembourg</a>, "La Voix" was the French language supplement of Saint-Paul's flagship "<a href="Luxemburger%20Wort">Luxemburger Wort</a>" until it was launched as a separate newspaper in 2001. The paper was published between Mondays and Saturdays.
"La Voix" was headquartered in the city of <a href="Luxembourg%20%28city%29">Luxembourg</a> and had a <a href="conservative">conservative</a> stance. The newspaper received €933,221 in annual <a href="Press%20subsidy%20in%20Luxembourg">state press subsidy</a> in 2009.
The circulation of "La Voix" was 9,909 copies in 2003. In 2004 the paper had a circulation of 4,000 copies. In 2006 its circulation was 8,529 copies. It was also 4,000 copies in 2010.
On 30 September 2011, the last edition of "La Voix" was published.
